edu.rit.util

Class PairBase<K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.PairBase<K>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key data type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntPair, LongPair, Pair

    public abstract class PairBase<K>
extends Object
implements Streamable
    Class PairBase is the abstract base class for a pair consisting of a key and its associated value. The key is defined in the base class; the value is defined in a subclass. The key must be an object suitable for use in a hashed data structure; that is, the key class must define the equals() and hashCode() methods properly. The key may be null. Once a key is stored in a pair, the state of the key must not be altered.

    Class PairBase is streamable. For object streaming to work properly, the key class must be streamable or serializable.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Determine if this pair is equal to the given object. The pairs are equal if their keys are equal, as determined by the key class's equals() method.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Object to test.
        Returns:
        True if this pair is equal to obj, false otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code for this pair. The hash code is that of the key, as returned by the key class's hashCode() method.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        Hash code.
